content.label:
Cannot get past adverts. Will not close, so I cannot play. Not interested in adverts. I’ll have to delete game if I don’t receive an answer. 

One star  because of not being to close ads. Disappointing,  because original game is so straight forward.

No offense, the game is incredible & beautifully illustrated to me. My only problem is how you’re capitalizing off of it, making us pay tokens, or even money to play for just 5 minutes. It’s not necessary, & utterly ruins the initial feel the game was meant to give, stripping away the freedom that once stood prideful atop this little arachnid’s back.

title.label: Great game but not a lot of levels that don’t require a 5.99 per month subscription.

content.label: I played the first game a long time ago and I thought of playing it again since I don’t have many games on my phone anymore. It took me forever to find the names of the games. I downloaded this one and got through the first few levels. Then I realized that to play the rest of the levels, I have pay $5.99 per month. I don’t want to pay $6 dollars so I can finish a mobile game that I’ve already started.
App updated then then wanted me to buy it again.  It couldn’t find my purchase and said contact support.  Here I am.

I bought this game when it was owned by a different company. When the game was sold , it was upgraded via the app store, and said upgrade forced a free “upgrade” to a Gameclub subscription model that I am not interested in. My game is now worthless because the app won’t let me opt out. I’m seriously thinking about reporting this to the Federal Trade Commission.

name.label: A guy you dont care about

content.label: I remember when this wasn’t a place riddled with in app purchases. Can’t you at least make enjoyable games?

The new gameclub has locked me out of my game. It states that if I had already bought it then I could still play but then states that it cannot find my purchase. 

It was a fun game when I played it last. Do not purchase now because it is part of a subscription.

I purchased this game on the App Store and now it is going through some outside subscription app service that said they can’t find where I purchased it on apple. They say on their web page that if you bought it you own it but until they can figure it out if I want to play they make me watch adds for game time.

Update - issue resolved. Thanks. 
Same issue as previous review. Game club update locked me out of game I paid for.

I purchased this game though Apple Apps. Your company has purchased this from the creator of the game. I see no reason why I should have to join your website to restore MY purchased game. I will delete this forever.
This new game club thing just locked me out of a paid game. Tried restoring the purchase and it says it can’t find it. Great. Thanks.

This is, in my humble opinion, the best game ever.  I've gone to great lengths to have it on multiple platforms, and have replayed it countless times. I've never encountered another game with such a depth to the story, or one with such unique play itself.  Location and weather features make for fresh play.  I've tried to spread the word, without giving too much of the mystery away.  Please try this game!  It is well worth the money, and your time!

I’ve gotten stuck very early in this game because there are no sparkles or clue where the opening is. Maybe I just haven’t found the way out of the first room one I’ve eaten all of the bugs. I don’t want to replay this level over and over...one after eating everything the spider disappeared! Where ever it went maybe where I need to go but I have no clue how my spider got there...help?!
This game was hard for me, but with a little help here and there I was able to figure out most of it. I found it highly entertaining. The only sour note I found was waiting for the weather to change.
Make spider 3 you have to and have a black widow spider
Spooky awesomeness
we also need co-op mode just like in the first game
I miss this game! Please consider developing a third one (fourth?)

title.label: Rated #3 in the Top Five Best Games on my IPad, maybe even #2

content.label: I’ve played through the first one so many times now, it’s ridiculous. When I went on the App Store and saw this, I instantly bought it. When I started playing through this, I was MIND-BLOWN. Simply MIND-BLOWN. It’s really cool. I love the fact that there’s a mystery to solve that’s the background of this game, and it’s really fun, mysterious, and slightly creepy at times. The graphics are really cool, the music is insanely good, and I love how creative it is. I’d recommend it to anyone who likes mysteries and adventure. It’s simply a must-have app.

Love this game, it's fun and unique. It kind of reminds me of Myst. I like the mystery aspect of it, I enjoy figuring out how to make the right webs, and I love how the game is from the perspective of a jumping spider. I enjoyed the first 'Spider' game, and this one is even better. The artwork for the spider types is amazing, and I appreciate the accuracy of their depiction. The game mechanics take patience, sometimes I'll have to zoom out to figure out how to construct a web or see how far to jump. I love how the little jumping spider crouches with the front legs positioned forwards just before a jump. It's a small detail but it's accurate to how a real jumping spider behaves. I enjoy these small details, and it is great that someone went to the effort to implement this accuracy into the game. I do love playing as Phidippus regius! :)

title.label: Clever concept but janky controls ruined it for me

content.label: Clever concept but janky controls ruined it for me
Very good and addictive game

See Mage Gauntlet or Wayward Souls for what the pro-swipe controls scheme is. 

This game needs pro-swipe. 
Pro-swipe to move, tap to jump. Entire game 100% better.

Remember, controls are the window to your game's soul.

Or at least non-randomly-inverting controls. When holding the left side, the spider moves left when facing upright (anticlockwise motion), left when facing upside down (clockwise motion), and random up or down when on a wall(I don't know motion).

At least make it consistent! 

Also, the spider looks like a jumping spider, but doesn't catch bugs mid-air, instead using a web to catch them...?
Loved the first one, but this one seems too difficult to control and understand. Lost interest almost immediately.
Moon no longer appears  with latest Apple system update.  Please fix ASAP

This is a love it or hate it type of game, for me it's a "love it". Trying out different ways of trapping bugs, and luring/scaring grasshoppers right into your web is a blast, not to mention the mysteries and puzzles. Having the same levels be totally different experiences based on time/weather gives it longevity most other games don't. The ONLY reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is the location system doesn't seem to want to work for me, I have to sometimes adjust the weather manually. I recommend this game whole heartedly, it can be hours, weeks or even months of fun depending on how often you play. For me I expect this game will last quite a while.
This is one of the best puzzle games I have ever played. Skill, intelligence, creativity and curiosity are all rewarded. Get it now!
Hard to control and really boring game. Lost interest quickly.

TLDR: controls are too difficult for kids, gameplay too boring for adults. 

The devs had some great ideas, and there is a great game in here somewhere. I especially love the innovative use of weather detection. And I don't think a similar game mechanic exists. But the controls and camera behavior do make things difficult. I don't know how you could have better controls, but it is hard in general. The UI is also not intuitive and lacks some basic navigation functions. Plus we really don't know or care what the goal is. 

Unfortunately this is a mediocre game because the innovative ideas were not implemented effectively. This in stark contrast to their outstanding title: waking Mars.

Gameplay is similar to the arcade game Qix but with multi-screen levels and an additional layer of storytelling. All this could be a nice combo, but unfortunately the control scheme is disappointing and the spider rarely goes where I want it to go.  I gave up after playing for about an hour.

I love the mystery,art style,look and feel of this beautiful game🕷🕸I think you should buy this legendary game! Nothing is wrong about this game.It is absolutely flawless!I recommend this game to you!🕷🕸🕷🕸🕷🕸🕷🕸🕷🕸🕷🕸🕷🕸🕷🕸

At first, I thought I was going to regret buying it. But now I'm truly in love with this game! The scenery is so beautiful! I love how you have to play on real different weather days to discover new secrets. So much fun! There's so much to do and discover! And the spiders are SO cute! ☺️ Best mystery/spider game out there! Highly recommended!
Great ingenuity and beautiful design. Excellent replay value (I've played the game through three times now). Highly recommend!
I'm not one to get sucked in to a lot of games. However, this one is very beautiful and enjoyable!

Honestly I don't know what to say I mean it is a masterpiece art style is Gorgeous This is idea people tried to achieve correctly but this is the only one that got it right the controls are tight and natural (easy to memorize) The game itself. Is amazing I can recommend this to anyone weather your 5 or 92 get this it's amazing

Amazing graphics and great interplay!  More than a scratch-the-surface mystery...dig deeper and learn of a Secret Society.   Several levels and varied plays available for different weather and moon phases.  Can't get enough!
What other game can let you be a spider and eat bugs. What's better is that you solve mysteries of the Blackbird estate. It's has a deep and great story
Even though real jumping spiders don't build webs like that, the movement mechanisms are spot on. It's also great to see and learn about the other bugs featured in the game.

If you enjoy games that challenge your wits, look no further. This game provides ample challenge for thoughtful minds. 

There are multiple layers of gameplay to engage. You can go for the top score. You can explore and piece together the many scattered clues and mysteries of the excellent in game story. Or you can go full monte and explore the real life secret society tied to the game, The Knights of the Buried Chambers. This metagame is NOT to be missed! 

No matter your approach, the art is gorgeous, the soundtrack is sublime, the gameplay is highly tuned, and the secrets -- oh the many secrets. They've caused me many sleepless nights wondering where to turn next. 

The asking price is a pittance for the mileage you can get out of this game. Do yourself a favor and get it!

Minus one star because some puzzles are only solvable on certain real-world calendar days.

The game IS fun and it IS horror. It handles everything very subtly: from the frowning family pictures, to the handprints on the walls in the background and the chlorophyll in the foreground.

Something wrong happened here and you are very much an unrelated observer to the aftermath.
Great little sequel to a great game. Now please get busy on Waking Mars 2 already. That game was simply the best game I've ever played on any platform.

I loved the first spider, and still do. This sequel ought to be a joy and in many ways it is. The art is lovely and the playing field is much larger. There are more types of bugs to eat, some that fight back. And you get to hunt at night or in the rain and get a different set of bugs to trap. The story is really just suggested by the things you see while hunting, and there are lots of nooks tucked away for you to find. All this is very good. But the moon phase idea tho at the core of the game was a mistake. I think most players would like to be able to play through the whole game, finding all the insects, solving all the puzzles on their own schedule: no waiting on the moon. It really is no fun after a while. This is a shame 'cause there is so much to like

USE ICLOUD FOR OUR SAVE DATA like any responsible dev. I just lost all progress due to having to restore as a new iPad. Since you don't save our progress in iCloud, I've got a fresh install with no progress staring me in the face.  

Add it to the shelf of great but unfinished games that tried to make me start over for no good reason.

Same basic mechanic and plot-discovery idea as before. More rooms to explore, now in elevation and floor plan modes. Bugs are trickier. Webs can collapse due to attacks of various kinds, and your spider can be attacked. 

The weather and day/night scenes are interesting flavors. The more clever insects are welcome as well. I like the elevation and floor plan views.

Personally I dislike the spider and web attacks. This crosses over too much into a battle game, detracting from the puzzle-solving. 

The worst feature is that some puzzle(s) can only solved during specific weather and day/night modes. How many people have the freedom to play day and night? Or to be free to play when it's raining? There's a limited option to change to rainy weather but it's only good once a week and for as long as you run the game. Quit to check mail or text someone and bam, you gotta wait another week. I'm severely downgrading my rating due to this silliness.

title.label: Lost all my progress with ios 9 upgrade

content.label: Great game and was on my way to completing before losing everything when I updated to io9 on my iPad2. Beware!!!

This has got to be one of those games the developer paid people to write 5 star reviews.  
Repeat.... Don't waste your money on this one, needs work and allot of it. The controls don't work that good, can't spin large webs, this was total waste. If I could give no star I would, but I can’t,

HOW DO I GET MY MONEY BACK?????
Boring

I have been playing this game nonstop for weeks. Things just keep popping up. I keep coming across new rooms, Easter eggs and secrets. ... 

For those who want to know what this game is about: there are two layers - one, you are a spider who builds webs and catches bugs. It's fun and can be really challenging at times due to heavier bugs and moving environments knocking down your web which you can only replenish by eating more bugs. Two, there is a mystery going on in the mansion you move around in that needs to be solved. 

As a spider you could'nt care more about the mystery. But as human it's extremely enthralling.

Clues, switches, hidden rooms, etc. are in every room. And it's a blast to find them, especially when they involve new and unseen bugs. 

The soundtrack is killer and the hand drawn graphic are awesome. 

On top of that the levels change depending on the time of day and weather. For instance if it's raining, different bugs will be available and different parts of the rooms will be open or closed, Ex: if it's raining you can't crawl up certain walls or get up drain pipes, but something may be flooded to let you get into a new area not seen before. 

I can't rant more about this game. It's on point.

Furthermore the mystery in the game extends into reality. You can research that yourself....

Happy hunting!
I bought this game because I loved the original.  This might be good if I could get it to open.  It is stuck on the opening title page and does not progress no matter what I try.
I knew I was bad with money but holy crap. Can't believe I spent $4.99 on this. Was expecting something better.
